name: Fitzpatrick Grand Central Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled on business
reviews.text: My second visit in four months. Am delighted to say it lived up to my expectations. Had a great room. Incredibly friendly staff and nothing is too much trouble for them. Would really recommend it as being very central - easy to get to everywhere from it.
reviews.title: Great stay again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Firstly, let me apologise for my delay in reviewing this wonderful hotel. My wife and I stayed here on a leg of our honeymoon. We absolutely loved this hotel and the location is spot on! We were greeted on a wet and windy evening by a friendly receptionist who apologised to us for the life being out of order (and we on the 9th floor!) But luckily, it was only one of the lifts so it wasn't all that bad! When we reached our room, we were delighted to see that we were staying in "The Frank McCourt Suite". The hotel had gone out of their way to upgrade us to a suite to help us to celebrate our honeymoon. So we dropped in this spacious room and headed out to explore the city (luckily the rain had stopped!)
reviews.title: A Haven amidst the madness of NYC!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On returning to our room, the hotel had left us a cold bottle of bubbly, chocolate covered strawberries, bottled water and chocolates. What a lovely surprise, one which we really appreciated.
reviews.title: Great hotel - will be back!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As mentioned before, the staff are very friendly and helpful in this hotel and they have excellent knowledge of the city. The room was very comfortable, with a lovely living area and massive bathroom. We would recommend this hotel without fail and when we return to NYC in the near future we will definitely stay in Fitzpatrick's Grand central. It is close to Times Square, 5th Avenue, Broadway, Central Park, Rockefeller Centre, Empire State Building and many more places. This saves you a small fortune on taxi fares and if you need to travel down or uptown, the subway is across the road in Grand Central Station.
reviews.title: Great little hotel in a great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Before going I read the reviews on here and was surprised at some of the negative comments that had been left. I arrived back to Glasgow yesterday morning after leaving on Monday evening and I would have happily stayed longer at the fitzpatrick longer if i could. The hotel itself is lovely, so warm and welcoming and the room was perfect. The bed was so comfy and the air con kept the room very cool. I can not speak highly enough of the staff, they constantly went out their way to help and always said hello and asked how your day went when you came back in to the hotel. The irish guy provided myself and my fiancee a good laugh when he had some banter with us. The people complaining about the lift is just stupid, the longest you had to wait was 5 mins. I would definetly come back to the hotel, as it was so central and easy to get everywhere. The room was kept clean every day, the housekeeping staff were lovely and always spoke to you. It was my first trip to America, and it has left a great impression on me. I will definetly be back to New York, and I would definetly come back to this hotel.
reviews.title: Staff Were Spot On!!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: Family of four stayed here for two weeks in August. Ended up with two inside rooms on different floors. Rooms were excellent size and we hear no noise. Some work going on with the lifts but nothing that caused any problems.
reviews.title: 2 Weeks In Auguest

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a problem with the phones (we couldn't call each others rooms) and we were offered a meal in the wheel tapper as a sorry.
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff on the front desk were excellent and each morning and afternoon they would ask what we had planned for the day and how our day had gone.
reviews.title: lovel hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Location was perfect for us, only 15 mins walk to times square and not much different to central park. Felt safe walking round on a night and the 99cent pizza shop at the corner was great for a quite bite last thing at night. Not being on a through road meant very little traffic. Grand central station is just at the top of the road and along a block.
reviews.title: Perfect location, brilliant service and a great value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Looking forward to getting back there soon hopefully !!
reviews.title: Good Choice for Midtown Manhattan

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: great location, good sized rooms, nice beds (but hard pillows).
reviews.title: mostly in line with everyone else!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: didnt much care for the pub attached and found their lack of internet access for non laptop owners archaic.
reviews.title: Great location, very comfortable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009
reviews.text: still, all good.
reviews.title: Excellent
Fitzpatricks is Fitz-brilliant
reviews.text: Stayed here for 3 nights. Very central, got bus in from JFK and only 3 minutes from Grand Central Station.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: 10 minutes to Times Square, Empire State etc.
reviews.title: Perfect Irish Oasis in New York

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room with king bed was adequate in size as was the bathroom. Nice towels, robes, a safe, coffee maker, fridge. Internet available for a fee but there's no business center with computers. We did not try their restaurant or room service. Very close to Grand Central station with its subway lines so easy to get up or downtown. The hotel is on a quieter street than those in Times Square. Booked on the hotel's website, got the long-stay rate and they reduced it automatically when rates went down.
reviews.title: good location, good room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you like Indian food, try Mint or Darbar.
reviews.title: fantastic bed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Enjoyed the Frick museum.
reviews.title: when do i go back?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled solo
reviews.text: fitzpatrick hotel is in a great location,just over road from grand central station,a perfect base to explore new york,beds were just great after a days sightseeing,bar was great to relax in ,suppose you could get cheaper room and decor is old fashioned but not grubby.its not as if you spend all your time in the hotel is it?staff very helpful although a free use of a room to freshen up would of been great when you have a night flight,overall a great place and we will be going back next year.
reviews.title: I'm going back as soon as possible

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: got advice from travel agents. didn't take up on it. found this on net. booked it. great choice. great hotel. great location. 60 yards from Grand Central station. excellent concierge. the best bed you will sleep in. quiet rooms. excellent staff. great bar. great beer. nothing bad to say. can't wait to go back.
reviews.title: Was disappointed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 1. small rooms (300sq.??) (trouble with 4 bags)bedsheets short, beds soft, but ok. Shower curtains,shower needs an update(see Holiday inn express)
reviews.title: typical ny

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 2. Windows ....loud ( use earplugs)
reviews.title: lovely hotel in a great location close to all major attractions

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled solo
reviews.text: 3. extra internet fee (seems typical ny)
reviews.title: lovely hotel, but smoky!
Fitzpatrick Grand central Hotel, New York, NY
reviews.text: 4. Location , Staff...very good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: 5. no business center...(bad)
reviews.title: Nice Hidden Gem in a Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: This hotel is clean, but it's quite tired. My bathroom had cracked tiles on the floor and dated bulb lights, like something you'd put in your suburban house in the 1980s. The shower was hot, but water pressure was fairly weak. The room itself was clean and the bed was comfortable, but furniture was, again, dated: basically, the sort of Holiday Inn-style, fake-ish, dark wood furniture you'd expect if you arrived at a hotel in the 1990s. It's clean, but scratched up. Same with the A/C unit in my room: dated, probably circa 1990s and quite a bit noisier -- and less efficient -- than a more modern HVAC unit. The pub downstairs is good enough, but beer prices are high ($8/pint), even by Manhattan standards. Staff were friendly and professional. Location is convenient to Grand Central (about a minute away) and its many subway lines, but otherwise in a dead canyon of office buildings. I know NYC well (so this wasn't a problem for me), but I wouldn't recommend first-time visitors stay at this hotel: the neighborhood lacks charm that can be found in other parts of the city. It is, perhaps, one of the dullest locations in the entire city. While spending the night at the hotel, a British Airways crew arrived, and that's what this hotel seems to do well: providing a comfortable (enough), dependable place to stay in an OK location for business travelers or tour groups. You can pay $250/night to stay here in a double room, or you can pay less than that to stay in a more charming, unique, interesting hotel -- in a nicer neighborhood -- by booking through Priceline or Hotel Tonight.
reviews.title: Clean, but very average hotel
Home away from home
reviews.text: The Fitzpatrick Hotel Group is a privately owned group of boutique hotels, still run by the same family who started the business in Ireland over 30 years ago. I've come here, to the Grand Central location, with my job for the past seventeen years, 3-4 times a year. It feels like my home away from home. Lovely, warm and genuine friendly and interested staff, front desk staff always smiling and really trying to make your stay a great one, housekeeping-ladies are so friendly, efficient and will bring you anything you might need, as well as RoomService; if there is anything you want change or you might crave something they don't have; they will really try hard to make you happy. The location is superb, it really couldn't be better, I love the fact it is right across the street for Grand Central Terminal, and all it has to offer; from very early morning until late at night; the lovely and very tempting foodmarket there, lots of great places to eat, amongst them; the famous Grand Central Oyster Bar.... and of course The Apple Store in Grand Central, for your browse at the latest technology. The hotel is 10 mins from the remarkable NY Public Library, which is just next to the most lovely and charming Bryant Park (which has free wifi throughout the park: fab!!!) 15 mins from Times Square, 15 mins to MOMA, 20 mins to Central Park.... Great shopping is right on your doorstep. It's nice to be able to quickly drop by your room, to load off bags, and have a little rest, before going out for a meal and a show. There are two fab coffee shops right outside the hotel, and the restaurant which is adjacent to the hotel, The Wheeltapper, serves great food, I love the nachos there! Can it be any better? I have booked a room for my family and myself in December, counting days; can't wait to return, and this time with my family, during Christmas, it's going to be amazing; to my home away from home.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Stayed at here between 9/27 - 10/1 and I would recommend it to anyone and everyone! It was booked last minute the night before we planned to travel and I wouldn't consider staying anywhere else when I return to the City.
reviews.title: Great find!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Pros: Great staff working on the front desk, friendly and welcoming.
reviews.title: #Sleepless in New York

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Clean and comfortable room.
reviews.title: quaint great little find

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Hotel was like an oasis in the middle of the hustle and bustle of New York. Rooms were exceptionally clean but the outstanding feature was the staff.Nothing was a bother to them from advising on good restaurants to printing off Boarding Passes.(Thanks Keiron). They are, without exception, a credit to the Fitzpatrick Group. I will definitely recommend this hotel to my friends and as Arnie says I will be back
reviews.title: Superb Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: Stayed here at the end of August 2013! Hotel location was excellent, on the door step of Grand Central Station, a short walk from Times Square! Room was spacious and clean (906), staff were helpful and friendly! I was delighted to find champagne and chocolate coated strawberries in our room as a gift for my birthday, a very kind and welcomed touch! We used the adjoining Wheeltapper for breakfast each day, we found it reasonable priced, and the staff were efficient and friendly! They remembered what we had the previous day and what our plans had been! I would highly recommend this hotel to anybody and hopefully be back!
reviews.title: Amazing Hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013
reviews.text: Just back from 6 nights in this lovely hotel. Staff were great and our room - 610 - was lovely.
reviews.title: Great location, staff and room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Like others we found NY noisy at night but we expected it and it added to the whole big city feel we loved.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is in a fantastic location right near Grand Central Station so the subway is on your doorstep. We always felt safe - on the subway, walking at night etc.
reviews.title: Disappointingly Average Hotel - Nice Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having visited New York at Christmas time last year, I was well aware of how expensive accommodation is during this period, however, when it comes to shopping I’m a sucker for punishment and returned again in December! We decided to stay in Fitzpatricks on Lexington Avenue after having stayed in the repulsive Sutton Suites last year we thought we deserved an upgrade! It was a huge improvement thankfully, regardless I do think it’s overrated. It is targeted at the Irish visitor but this is very much overdone, from the framed picture of President McAleese in the reception area to the map of Ireland painted onto the ceiling of the bar. I accept that this would make people feel at home etc, however when I’m away for a few days I would prefer not to be constantly reminded of all things Irish!
reviews.title: This Hotel Would Certainly Not Make The Top of My List

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: The rooms are not spectacular, the beds were extremely soft and not very comfortable, the handle on our bathroom door kept falling off and the halls were extremely grubby. The hotel is dated and is in need of a makeover. The bar food was not very good and the breakfast was nothing to write home about. The location was great and the staff were extremely nice but I wouldn’t be in a hurry to stay here again.
reviews.title: Great location, comfortable, but housekeeping was a big problem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My young teen and I stayed for six nights in late March and found the hotel ideal for its location, given its proximity to Grand Station Terminal (GST), with direct subway lines uptown, downtown and to Times Square, as well as a few blocks walk to the United Nations and a slightly longer walk to central Midtown sites and shopping. The hotel feels charming upon entry, and our room on the 7th floor was comfortable and very quiet, even facing the street (GST cuts off traffic on 44th so that helps with traffic volume and noise). The bathroom had a decent counter for all your toiletries and wasn’t miniature like some hotels. The hotel staff in the lobby (desk and door) was polite and helpful but HOUSEKEEPING STAFF WAS A DEFINITE PROBLEM. We had to ask every day for an additional towel which got really tiresome since it seems that if there are 3 or 4 used towels, they should just bring 3 or 4 fresh ones instead of 2. (If washing towels is a problem, how about asking guests to indicate they want clean towels and sheets everyday as hotels do in California and Hawaii where water is more scarce and we always use the same linens for multiple days?) On the third day, a particularly cold and blustery one, housekeeping left our window open and when we returned from the UN at lunchtime, it was already freezing in there. Most days we were out past dinnertime so I can’t imagine how cold it would have been in our room if we had returned late as usual. The coup de grace with housekeeping, however, is that they removed items on two different days that were NOT placed in or were even near the trash cans. These were empty glass and plastic bottles, some of which we intended to keep using everyday as we toured the city (to carry water) or to bring home as a souvenir (from a local NY dairy). I have never stayed in any hotel anywhere at which the housekeeping staff took any item that was not actually in or immediately adjacent to the trash can. I was absolutely shocked that a bottle lying on top of my suitcase or near the TV or on the bathroom counter would be snatched. I suppose housekeeping thought they were being thorough and helpful, but obviously that was not the case. After the second incident, I had to ask the hotel manager to come up to our room and discuss the daily-occurring housekeeping problems. The manager on duty was suitably apologetic and professional. The next night, we came back to find a complimentary bottle of red wine but, as it was already 11 pm and we were leaving the next morning and only one of us could drink, we returned the bottle to the desk and they offered up instead a complimentary continental breakfast which we tried. We had eaten breakfast at the hotel’s pub earlier in the week as we received a $50 coupon towards food and drink upon check-in. Our impression was that the food was mediocre given the price and Midtown location. There are plenty of relatively inexpensive, tasty and quick food choices on two different levels at Grand Central Terminal – go there for breakfast items or a fast dinner on the way to the theatre. Having a room fridge was great for breakfast items like fruit juice and yogurt and for dinner leftovers. One last observation: I could not access the online reservation system for the hotel’s website via Firefox or Internet Explorer; I had to call to make a reservation, and that was frustrating as I wanted to check different dates. I would recommend Fitzpatrick’s Grand Central because the rooms are comfortable, decent size, have the options I desired and it’s a great location. Just watch out for the inconsistent housekeeping staff and speak up if things are not to your liking.
reviews.title: Very good hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just back from 3 nights in NYC and stayed in the Fitzpatrick Grand Central. We thought the hotel was great - location, staff, cleanliness, good size room and value for money (paid just over equivalent of €500 for 3 nights). Only a few small things that could have been better
reviews.title: Over rated

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: * Found the bed way too soft (but that's a personal opinion and most other reviewers rave about the bed!)
reviews.title: Would not stay again

description: The central location and attentive service distinguish the Fitzpatrick Grand Central.
